title: Old videos are being falsely shared in the context of Cyclone Amphan
subtitle: While one video shared as that of Cyclone Amphan is related to Cyclone Fani (2019) in Odisha, the other is related to Hurricane Michael (2018) in Florida.
author: factly.in
vclaim:
A couple of videos are being shared widely on social media with the claim that they are related to Cyclone Amphan. Cyclone Amphan has made landfall in West Bengal on 20 May 2020, causing severe damage in the coastal areas of West Bengal and Odisha. Let’s fact-check whether the videos in the posts are related to Cyclone Amphan.

It was found that the video in the post is old and not related to the recent cyclone. The video shows Cyclone Fani battering coastal areas of Odisha last year. Cyclone Fani, an extremely severe cyclonic storm, has caused large scale damage in large parts of coastal Odisha and made landfall in Puri on 03 May 2019.

It was found that a news channel has published the same video in October 2018 with the title – ‘Video shows Hurricane Michael tearing home apart in Panama City Beach’. Also, the same video can be found on multiple stock video websites with the description that it is related to Hurricane Michael.

To sum it up, old videos are being falsely shared in the context of Cyclone Amphan.
